intro: Senecio calthifolius, commonly known as the "white ragwort," is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, woolly leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Senecio calthifolius typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It is considered an ornamental plant in some regions due to its unique appearance.
